trans-unit.source: This article explains how to receive content in your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app shared from another app using Share contract.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to receive content in your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app shared from another app using Share contract.

trans-unit.source: This Share contract allows your app to be presented as an option when the user invokes Share.
trans-unit.target: This Share contract allows your app to be presented as an option when the user invokes Share.

trans-unit.source: Receive data
trans-unit.target: Receive data

trans-unit.source: Receive data
trans-unit.target: Receive data

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to receive content in your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app shared from another app using Share contract.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to receive content in your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app shared from another app using Share contract.

trans-unit.source: This Share contract allows your app to be presented as an option when the user invokes Share.
trans-unit.target: This Share contract allows your app to be presented as an option when the user invokes Share.

trans-unit.source: Declare your app as a share target
trans-unit.target: Declare your app as a share target

trans-unit.source: The system displays a list of possible target apps when a user invokes Share.
trans-unit.target: The system displays a list of possible target apps when a user invokes Share.

trans-unit.source: In order to appear on the list, your app need to declare that it supports the Share contract.
trans-unit.target: In order to appear on the list, your app need to declare that it supports the Share contract.

trans-unit.source: This lets the system know that your app is available to receive content.
trans-unit.target: This lets the system know that your app is available to receive content.

trans-unit.source: Open the manifest file.
trans-unit.target: Open the manifest file.

trans-unit.source: It should be called something like **package.appxmanifest**.
trans-unit.target: It should be called something like **package.appxmanifest**.

trans-unit.source: Open the **Declarations** tab.
trans-unit.target: Open the **Declarations** tab.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Share Target** from the **Available Declarations** list and click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Share Target** from the **Available Declarations** list and click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Choose file types and formats
trans-unit.target: Choose file types and formats

trans-unit.source: Next, decide what file types and data formats you support.
trans-unit.target: Next, decide what file types and data formats you support.

trans-unit.source: The Share APIs support several standard formats, such as Text, HTML, and Bitmap.
trans-unit.target: The Share APIs support several standard formats, such as Text, HTML, and Bitmap.

trans-unit.source: You can also specify custom file types and data formats.
trans-unit.target: You can also specify custom file types and data formats.

trans-unit.source: If you do, remember that source apps have to know what those types and formats are, otherwise those apps can't use the formats to share data.
trans-unit.target: If you do, remember that source apps have to know what those types and formats are, otherwise those apps can't use the formats to share data.

trans-unit.source: Only register for formats your app can handle.
trans-unit.target: Only register for formats your app can handle.

trans-unit.source: Only target apps that support the data being shared appear when the user invokes share.
trans-unit.target: Only target apps that support the data being shared appear when the user invokes share.

trans-unit.source: To set file types:
trans-unit.target: To set file types:

trans-unit.source: Open the manifest file.
trans-unit.target: Open the manifest file.

trans-unit.source: It should be called something like **package.appxmanifest**.
trans-unit.target: It should be called something like **package.appxmanifest**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Supported File Types** section of the **Declarations** page, click **Add New**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Supported File Types** section of the **Declarations** page, click **Add New**.

trans-unit.source: Type the file name extension that you want to support.
trans-unit.target: Type the file name extension that you want to support.

trans-unit.source: For example, .docx.
trans-unit.target: For example, .docx.

trans-unit.source: You need to include the period.
trans-unit.target: You need to include the period.

trans-unit.source: If you want to support all file types, check the **SupportsAnyFileType** box.
trans-unit.target: If you want to support all file types, check the **SupportsAnyFileType** box.

trans-unit.source: To set data formats:
trans-unit.target: To set data formats:

trans-unit.source: Open the manifest file.
trans-unit.target: Open the manifest file.

trans-unit.source: Open the **Data Formats** section of the **Declarations** page and click **Add New**.
trans-unit.target: Open the **Data Formats** section of the **Declarations** page and click **Add New**.

trans-unit.source: Type the name of the data format you support.
trans-unit.target: Type the name of the data format you support.

trans-unit.source: For example, "Text".
trans-unit.target: For example, "Text".

trans-unit.source: Handle share activation
trans-unit.target: Handle share activation

trans-unit.source: When a user selects your app (usually by selecting it from a list of available target apps in the share UI), an [**Application.OnShareTargetActivated**][OnShareTargetActivated] event is raised.
trans-unit.target: When a user selects your app (usually by selecting it from a list of available target apps in the share UI), an [**Application.OnShareTargetActivated**][OnShareTargetActivated] event is raised.

trans-unit.source: Your app needs to handle this event to process the data the user wants to share.
trans-unit.target: Your app needs to handle this event to process the data the user wants to share.

trans-unit.source: Note that if your app is running when it is activated as a Share target, the existing instance of your app is terminated and a new instance of your app is launched to handle the contract.
trans-unit.target: Note that if your app is running when it is activated as a Share target, the existing instance of your app is terminated and a new instance of your app is launched to handle the contract.

trans-unit.source: The data that the user wants to share is contained in a ShareOperation object.
trans-unit.target: The data that the user wants to share is contained in a ShareOperation object.

trans-unit.source: You can use this object to check the format of the data it contains.
trans-unit.target: You can use this object to check the format of the data it contains.

trans-unit.source: Report sharing status
trans-unit.target: Report sharing status

trans-unit.source: In some cases, it can take time for your app to process the data it wants to share.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, it can take time for your app to process the data it wants to share.

trans-unit.source: Examples include users sharing collections of files or images.
trans-unit.target: Examples include users sharing collections of files or images.

trans-unit.source: These items are larger than a simple text string, so they take longer to process.
trans-unit.target: These items are larger than a simple text string, so they take longer to process.

trans-unit.source: After calling [**ReportStarted**][ReportStarted], don't expect any more user interaction with your app.
trans-unit.target: After calling [**ReportStarted**][ReportStarted], don't expect any more user interaction with your app.

trans-unit.source: As a result, you shouldn't call it unless your app is at a point where it can be dismissed by the user.
trans-unit.target: As a result, you shouldn't call it unless your app is at a point where it can be dismissed by the user.

trans-unit.source: With an extended share, it's possible that the user might dismiss the source app before your app has all the data from the DataPackage object.
trans-unit.target: With an extended share, it's possible that the user might dismiss the source app before your app has all the data from the DataPackage object.

trans-unit.source: As a result, we recommend that you let the system know when your app has acquired the data it needs.
trans-unit.target: As a result, we recommend that you let the system know when your app has acquired the data it needs.

trans-unit.source: This way, the system can suspend or terminate the source app as necessary.
trans-unit.target: This way, the system can suspend or terminate the source app as necessary.

trans-unit.source: If something goes wrong, call [**ReportError**][ReportError] to send an error message to the system.
trans-unit.target: If something goes wrong, call [**ReportError**][ReportError] to send an error message to the system.

trans-unit.source: The user will see the message when they check on the status of the share.
trans-unit.target: The user will see the message when they check on the status of the share.

trans-unit.source: At that point, your app is shut down and the share is ended.
trans-unit.target: At that point, your app is shut down and the share is ended.

trans-unit.source: The user will need to start again to share the content to your app.
trans-unit.target: The user will need to start again to share the content to your app.

trans-unit.source: Depending on your scenario, you may decide that a particular error isn't serious enough to end the share operation.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your scenario, you may decide that a particular error isn't serious enough to end the share operation.

trans-unit.source: In that case, you can choose to not call **ReportError** and to continue with the share.
trans-unit.target: In that case, you can choose to not call **ReportError** and to continue with the share.

trans-unit.source: Finally, when your app has successfully processed the shared content, you should call [**ReportCompleted**][ReportCompleted] to let the system know.
trans-unit.target: Finally, when your app has successfully processed the shared content, you should call [**ReportCompleted**][ReportCompleted] to let the system know.

trans-unit.source: When you use these methods, you usually call them in the order just described, and you don't call them more than once.
trans-unit.target: When you use these methods, you usually call them in the order just described, and you don't call them more than once.

trans-unit.source: However, there are times when a target app can call [**ReportDataRetrieved**][ReportDataRetrieved] before [**ReportStarted**][ReportStarted].
trans-unit.target: However, there are times when a target app can call [**ReportDataRetrieved**][ReportDataRetrieved] before [**ReportStarted**][ReportStarted].

trans-unit.source: For example, the app might retrieve the data as part of a task in the activation handler, but not call **ReportStarted** until the user clicks a Share button.
trans-unit.target: For example, the app might retrieve the data as part of a task in the activation handler, but not call **ReportStarted** until the user clicks a Share button.

trans-unit.source: Return a QuickLink if sharing was successful
trans-unit.target: Return a QuickLink if sharing was successful

trans-unit.source: When a user selects your app to receive content, we recommend that you create a [**QuickLink**][QuickLink].
trans-unit.target: When a user selects your app to receive content, we recommend that you create a [**QuickLink**][QuickLink].

trans-unit.source: A **QuickLink** is like a shortcut that makes it easier for users to share information with your app.
trans-unit.target: A **QuickLink** is like a shortcut that makes it easier for users to share information with your app.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could create a **QuickLink** that opens a new mail message pre-configured with a friend's email address.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could create a **QuickLink** that opens a new mail message pre-configured with a friend's email address.

trans-unit.source: A **QuickLink** must have a title, an icon, and an Id.
trans-unit.target: A **QuickLink** must have a title, an icon, and an Id.

trans-unit.source: The title (like "Email Mom") and icon appear when the user taps the Share charm.
trans-unit.target: The title (like "Email Mom") and icon appear when the user taps the Share charm.

trans-unit.source: The Id is what your app uses to access any custom information, such as an email address or login credentials.
trans-unit.target: The Id is what your app uses to access any custom information, such as an email address or login credentials.

trans-unit.source: When your app creates a **QuickLink**, the app returns the **QuickLink** to the system by calling [**ReportCompleted**][ReportCompleted].
trans-unit.target: When your app creates a **QuickLink**, the app returns the **QuickLink** to the system by calling [**ReportCompleted**][ReportCompleted].

trans-unit.source: A **QuickLink** does not actually store data.
trans-unit.target: A **QuickLink** does not actually store data.

trans-unit.source: Instead, it contains an identifier that, when selected, is sent to your app.
trans-unit.target: Instead, it contains an identifier that, when selected, is sent to your app.

trans-unit.source: Your app is responsible for storing the Id of the **QuickLink** and the corresponding user data.
trans-unit.target: Your app is responsible for storing the Id of the **QuickLink** and the corresponding user data.

trans-unit.source: When the user taps the **QuickLink**, you can get its Id through the [**ShareOperation.QuickLinkId**][QuickLInkId] property.
trans-unit.target: When the user taps the **QuickLink**, you can get its Id through the [**ShareOperation.QuickLinkId**][QuickLInkId] property.
